ACT
4 
GENERAL PROVISIONS
A deceased natural person (the testator) is inherited by the person who acquired the inheritance right upon his death (the heir).
Every person is capable of inheriting, unless otherwise determined by law.
Inheritance rights are acquired according to the provisions of this Act, on the basis of a will or on the basis of the law.
The inheritance right is acquired at the time of the testator's death. The acquirer of the right of inheritance may renounce it according to the provisions of this Act, so it will be treated as if he had never acquired it.
